articles.title: Multi-Tier Power Stations on Chongchon River Go Operational
articles.content:
Multi-Tier Power Stations on Chongchon River Go Operational
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Multi-tier power stations on the River Chongchon went operational.
					 The stations are the labor gifts the Korean people presented to the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) with loyalty.
					
					 The 10 multi-tier power stations in the 80 km-long section of the River Chongchon would contribute to the building of an economic power and improvement of people's living standard.
					
					 An inaugural ceremony of the power stations was held at Huichon Power Station No. 9 on November 17.
					
					 Present there were leading officials of the party and state, the ministers of electric power industry, metal industry, railways, construction and building-materials industry, electronics industry and machine-building industry, the president of the State Academy of Sciences, the chief secretaries of the provincial committees of the WPK, officials and members of shock brigades who took part in the construction of the power stations and others.
					
					 A congratulatory message from the Central Committee of the WPK to the builders, officials and helpers who performed shinning labor feats in building the power stations was conveyed by Pak Pong Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and premier of the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 O Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, said in his inaugural speech that the completion of the 10 multi-tier power stations on the River Chongchon in a short span of time as monumental structures in the era of Marshal Kim Jong Un is of great significance in demonstrating the rapid development of Songun Korea.
					
					 The speaker called upon the builders of power stations on the River Chongchon to demonstrate their heroic stamina once again in the all-out drive for presenting a labor gift to the 7th Congress of the WPK with loyalty.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets President of Int'l Judo Federation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets President of Int'l Judo Federation
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Marius Vizer, president of the International Judo Federation, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to Oman Sultan
articles.content:
Greetings to Oman Sultan
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Qaboos Bin Said, sultan of Oman, on its national day.
					 The message wished friendly Oman development and prosperity, expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to French FM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to French FM
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Sunday sent a message of sympathy to French Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Development Laurent Fabius in connection with the recent terrorist attacks in Paris, France that claimed huge casualties.
					 Expressing principled stand against all forms of terrorism, the message sincerely hoped that the French people would eradicate the aftermath of the heart-rending tragedy and bring back peace and stability at an early date.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Here
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation led by Minister of Justice Alexandr Konovalov arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: Sojourn of President of Int'l Judo Federation Here
articles.content:
Sojourn of President of Int'l Judo Federation Here
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Marius Vizer, president of the International Judo Federation, Tuesday visited the Combat Sports Gymnasium in Chongchun Street.
					 After looking round the gymnasium, that has been splendidly renovated, the president met Judoists practicing there and talked with them.
					
					 He also toured the People's Open-air Ice Rink and other places.

articles.title: Anniversary of Establishment of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and Poland, Polish Independence Day Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Establishment of Diplomatic Ties between DPRK and Poland, Polish Independence Day Marked
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- There took place a film show at the Chollima Hall of Culture Tuesday to mark the 67th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Poland and the anniversary of Polish independence in the joint name of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Polish embassy here and the DPRK-Poland Friendship Association.
					 Present there were Ryu Kyong Il, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Poland Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people in the city, Polish Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Dariusz Pawlik and staff members of the Polish embassy here. 
					
					 Also present there were diplomatic envoys and representatives of the international bodies here.
					
					 At the film show speeches were made first.
					
					 Participants watched a Polish feature film.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Jon U Bong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Late Jon U Bong
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Tuesday sent a wreath to the bier of People's Artiste Jon U Bong, former teacher of the Vocal Music Faculty of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Commemorative Diploma to Kim Jong Un from Brazilian Party
articles.content:
Commemorative Diploma to Kim Jong Un from Brazilian Party
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a commemorative diploma by the Marxist-Leninist Communist Party of Brazil for marking the 24th anniversary of the publication of its organ Inverta.
					 It was conveyed to Kim Chol Hak, DPRK ambassador to Brazil, by General Secretary of the party Aluicio Bevilaqua on November 7.
					
					 Written in the diploma were letters "We pay highest respect to Comrade Kim Jong Un. On the occasion of the 24th anniversary of the publication of paper 'Inverta'. November 7, 2015".

articles.title: DWUK's Founding Anniversary Observed
articles.content:
DWUK's Founding Anniversary Observed
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Women's Union of Korea marked its 70th founding anniversary.
					The union is a reliable helper of the Workers' Party of Korea as it has remained true to the idea and cause of the party, a transmission belt linking the party with the women and a powerful ideological and educational organization training its members as Songun revolutionary fighters.
					
					President Kim Il Sung founded the union on Nov. 18, Juche 34 (1945), clearly indicated the way to be followed by it and led it to creditably play its role at every stage of the development of the revolution.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il provided the important guidelines to be held fast to by the union in carrying out the revolutionary cause of Songun and reposed deep trust in it.
					
					A national meeting marking its 70th founding anniversary took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					
					Present at the meeting were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials of the relevant field and the union and its members.
					
					Kim Ki Nam read out a congratulatory message sent by the C.C., the WPK to the organizations of various levels, officials and members of the union on the occasion of its 70th founding anniversary.
					
					The message said that over the past 70 years since its founding the union has developed into a revolutionary organization of the women boundlessly loyal to the party and leader under the wise guidance, deep trust and warm love of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and successfully performed its mission and role on behalf of the times and history, leaving a clear mark in the history of the struggle of the Korean people.
					
					It highly praised its organizations of various levels and their officials and members for having devotedly worked to develop the union into the ranks of female revolutionaries and creditably fulfill their noble responsibilities and roles on behalf of the times and revolution in the drive for winning the final victory.
					
					Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the union, made a report at the meeting.

articles.title: DPRK Girl Footballers Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Girl Footballers Back Home
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK girl footballers came back home Tuesday after winning the 2015 AFC U-16 Women's title.
					 The players and coaches were greeted at Pyongyang International Airport by Korean People's Army General Ri Jong Mu, First Vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports Kim Jong Su, officials concerned and their families.
					
					 Sportspersons presented garlands and flowers to the players and coaches.

articles.title: Ulsa Five-point Treaty, Fraudulent Document
articles.content:
Ulsa Five-point Treaty, Fraudulent Document
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- It is 110 years since the Japanese imperialists cooked up the "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty" on November 17, 1905.
					 The "treaty" was a fraudulent document enforced by force of arms.
					
					 At that time Hirobumi Ito, chieftain of Japan's aggression on Korea, deployed the Japanese aggression troops in various parts of Seoul where Korea's Imperial Palace was located. After surrounding the palace with double and triple rings of troops, he dared enter the palace to compel the Emperor Kojong to conclude a "treaty".
					
					 When the conclusion of the "treaty" was refused at the palace, the Japanese imperialists enforced it on ministers of the Korean government with use of arms, conducting such impudent act of stamping the then foreign ministry's official seal on the "treaty" by themselves.
					
					 That's why in its report submitted to the United Nations General Assembly in 1963 the United Nations Commission on International Law singled the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" out as one of the four invalid treaties in the world which were concluded by force.
					
					 The Italian newspaper Il Manifesto said that the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" is the most fraudulent document in the world history and Japan is an impudent robber as it cooked up a treaty between countries at its own will, forging a history.

articles.title: Planting Ulmus Pumila Encouraged in DPRK
articles.content:
Planting Ulmus Pumila Encouraged in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- It has been encouraged in the DPRK to plant Ulmus Pumila as part of the efforts to introduce the agro-forestry management on a wide scale.
					 Ulmus Pumila has been considered to be one of good species for agro-forestry management, said Kye Un Hui, a researcher of the Land and Environmental Conservation Exchange Company.
					
					 Ulmus Pumila has wide range of utility for its high economic value, she said, and continued:
					
					 It is strong in vitality with 98 percent of rooting rate and grows well even in the area at the height of 1 300 meters above sea level.
					
					 Sinphyong and Yonthan counties in North Hwanghae Province are taking much profit by encouraging the cultivation of Ulmus Pumila.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean FM's Diplomacy Soliciting Cooperation in Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean FM's Diplomacy Soliciting Cooperation in Anti-DPRK Nuclear Racket
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- South Korean Foreign Minister Yun Pyong Se is busy with diplomacy soliciting "cooperation" in the nuclear racket against the DPRK. 
					 At recent talks with the Iranian foreign minister Yun jabbered that he hoped to see the north draw a lesson from Iran's nuclear agreement, adding that he hoped Iran would exercise positive influence on the solution of the north's nuclear issue.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What Yun uttered is a revelation of south Korea's invariable scenario to isolate the DPRK in the international arena and stifle the compatriots in the north with nuclear weapons in collusion with outside forces at any cost. 
					
					 Yun's ongoing ridiculous diplomacy is touching off surging indignation among all Koreans who desire the nation's reconciliation and unity, peace and reunification.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities have true willingness to solve the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, they should stop the above-said diplomacy, open to public the criminal acts of having introduced nuclear weapons of the U.S. and frantically joined in nuclear war exercises of outside forces against the north and discard sycophancy towards the U.S., a factor of inviting national ruin.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should bear in mind that their acts of escalating the confrontation with compatriots would only throw hurdles in the way of improving the inter-Korean relations and the said diplomacy would further precipitate their self-destruction.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon those attempting to hurt its dignity and social system which its people consider as their life and soul but wipe out them to the last man.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Awaken from Daydream of "Unification of Social Systems"
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Awaken from Daydream of "Unification of Social Systems"
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive talked about the need to introduce "state-compiled" history textbook at Chongwadae on November 5, blustering that "what is very important before unification is to have high self-esteem and clear outlook on the value of history." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in an article in this regard: 
					
					 This is an open declaration of her intention to embellish and propagandize the corrupt "social system under liberal democracy" and the disgraceful history of the U.S. colonial rule with the rhetoric of "value" and "legitimacy" through the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook and achieve the "unification of the social systems" on that basis. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' campaign for introducing "state-compiled" history textbook is an unpardonable confrontation racket aimed to malignantly slander the dignified ideology and social system of the DPRK and stir up hostility toward them in a bid to realize the daydream of achieving "unification of the social systems," the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 While rewriting history textbook, the south Korean conservative group is malignantly hurting the dignity and social system of the DPRK. It is working hard to distort and besmirch the glorious history of the anti-Japanese armed struggle which culminated in the liberation of the country under the banner of the great Juche idea and opened up new origin for independence and prosperity and the shining history of the DPRK that has fully demonstrated the dignity and might of the nation. 
					
					 Needless to say, this is a cynical ploy to fan up in the south Korean society the negative concept and repugnancy towards the dignified history of the DPRK and socialist system centered on the popular masses through anti-DPRK propaganda in an effort to realize their wild ambition for achieving "unification under liberal democracy." 
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to face up to the trend of the times and awaken from the daydream of "unification of social systems" as it will bring only confrontation and war.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Blasted for Suppressing Participants in Mass Rally
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Blasted for Suppressing Participants
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea in an editorial on Sunday blasted the security authorities for brutally suppressing the participants who turned out in the all-out people's rally in Seoul last Saturday.
					 It said: Riot police set up barricades here and there and blocked roads leading to Kwanghwamun Plaza and indiscriminately fired tear liquid cannon at the participants. A farmer in his 60s was seriously wounded by tear liquid on his chest and face.
					
					 It is a human rights abuse to spread tear liquid at the masses.
					
					 But the police did not express any regret, the editorial noted, adding that the present regime is utterly impudent.
					
					 The editorial urged the "government" to apologize to the nation for the brutal suppression and punish those responsible.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Mull Staging War Drill on Forefront
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Mull Staging War Drill on Forefront
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The Fifth Corps of the south Korean army announced that it would stage anti-infiltration drill in the area of Cholwon, south Korean Kangwon Province, and Phochon, Kyonggi Province, from November 16 to 20, according to the south Korean KBS. 
					 The warmongers are mulling staging a firing drill and other war rehearsal with huge war hardware and civilians, autonomous organizations and police in those areas involved.

articles.title: S. Korean Media Slams Justice Minister's Outbursts Insulting just Action of People
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Slams Justice Minister's Outbursts Insulting just Action of People
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, south Korean internet newspaper, in an editorial on Monday denounced the minister of Justice for his outbursts insulting the just actions of south Koreans from all walks of life.
					 The editorial accused the minister of threatening to severely punish the participants in the all-out people's action in Seoul held on Nov. 14 after branding it as an "illegal and violent group action."
					
					 It also blasted him for not uttering even a word of apology for the undemocratic and inhuman police suppression of the participants in the action.
					
					 Even before the start of the rally the police indiscriminately fired tear liquid at the masses, the editorial said, adding:
					
					 Had the judicial authorities strictly and fairly enforced law against the unwarranted exercise of power, not against weak and guiltless masses, the all-out people's action would not have taken place.
					
					 What the Justice minister uttered was an unconstitutional and undemocratic logic of dictatorship as it was contrary to the freedom of assembly and demonstration.
					
					 If the judicial authorities suppress the people under the pretext of the action, it will touch off stronger resistance of the masses, the editorial warned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Guinea
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A Guinean committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 10.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting and lecture in praise of noble revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il between Nov. 11 and Dec. 20.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Regional Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Regional Organization
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated by the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on Nov. 10.
					 Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the alliance, and Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, were elected co-chairmen of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize significant political and cultural events including a seminar on the exploits Kim Jong Il performed for the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Guinean Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Guinean Personages
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il developed in depth the immortal Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and turned the DPRK into an invincible power which no force dares provoke and consolidated the Workers' Party of Korea to be an ever-victorious party by pursuing Songun politics.
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said this in a speech made at the inaugural ceremony of a Guinean committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il held on Nov. 10.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 We recollect the noble revolutionary career and undying exploits of Kim Jong Il with profound reverence for him. 
					
					 He is always alive in the hearts of humankind for his immortal exploits performed for the global cause of independence.
					
					 His cause will be successfully accomplished by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Lansana Komara, permanent secretary of the Guinean People's Assembly, and Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, said that Kim Jong Il was a peerlessly great man who made undying contributions to the human cause of independence and a guardian of the world socialist cause and peace. The service personnel and people of the DPRK will surely build a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, they added.

articles.title: Successful Celebrations of WPK's 70th Birthday Hailed
articles.content:
Successful Celebrations of WPK's 70th Birthday Hailed
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- Keith Bennett, vice-chairman of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, contributed an article titled "Celebrations of 70th founding anniversary of Workers' Party of Korea demonstrate militant might, unity and cohesion and internationalism" to the November-December issue of the organ of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist).
					 He said:
					
					 The 70th birthday of the WPK was one of the greatest holidays for the Korean people this year.
					
					 The Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists in the Fatherland Liberation War and have made great progress in all fabrics of society such as realization of socialist industrialization and enforcement of free education and health care system despite the U.S. ceaseless nuclear blackmail and economic sanctions, consecutive years of natural disasters, collapse of socialism in the former Soviet Union and the East European countries and other unspeakable difficulties and challenges over the past 70 years under the leadership of the WPK.
					
					 The WPK has made great contributions to the development of international working-class movement and rendered unsparing support and solidarity to the progressive people in their anti-imperialist struggle.
					
					 There took place a military parade and public procession of Pyongyang citizens in celebration of the 70th anniversary of the WPK at Kim Il Sung Square in the centre of Pyongyang City on Oct. 10.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un made a very meaningful address at that celebration.
					
					 The writer recalled that delegations of the Communist Part of China (CPC), the Communist Party of Vietnam and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and the party and government delegation of Cuba took part in the celebrations for solidarity with the Korean revolution and that Kim Jong Un received the CPC delegation.

articles.title: International Seminar against Neo-liberalism Held
articles.content:
International Seminar against Neo-liberalism Held
Pyongyang, November 17 (KCNA) -- The 10th international seminar on the struggle against neo-liberalism took place in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on November 6 and 7 under the sponsorship of the Marxist-Leninist Communist Party of Brazil.
					 Present there were at least 300 persons of the Brazilian national assembly, political parties, public organizations and media.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Brazil and foreign diplomatic envoys.
					
					 An opening address was made by General Secretary of the Brazilian party Aluicio Bevilaqua to be followed by congratulatory speeches.
					
					 Discussions were made on the subjects including "Crisis of capital and imperialist war" and "Crisis of capital and neo-liberalist attack". The floor was taken by the DPRK ambassador to Brazil, diplomatic envoys and representatives of political parties and organizations aspiring after socialism against imperialism.
					
					 When the DPRK ambassador was making speech, the participants shouted slogans "Long live Comrade Kim Jong Un!" "Long live the Workers' Party of Korea!" "Long live the heroic Korean people!" "Long live the Songun politics!" and "Down with the U.S. imperialism!" expressing support for the just cause of the Korean people demonstrating only victory in defending socialism and struggling against imperialism and U.S. by dint of Songun.
					
					 The final declaration adopted at the seminar said that the DPRK is resolutely struggling to defend the sovereignty of the country and gains of socialism.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al sultan de Oman
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al sultan de Oman
Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 17 un mensaje de felicitacion al sultan de Oman, Qaboos Bin Said Al Said, con motivo del dia nacional de este pais.
					El remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Oman seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose y desea a Oman amistoso el desarrollo y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Conmemoran aniversario 70 de fundacion de Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea
articles.content:
Conmemoran aniversario 70 de fundacion de Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea
Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea acogio el aniversario 70 de su fundacion.
					La UMDC es ayudante confiable del Partido del Trabajo de Corea que apoya fielmente la idea y la causa de esta organizacion politica, correa de transmision que une el Partido con las mujeres y la poderosa entidad de educacion ideologica que forma a las miembros de la UMDC como combatientes revolucionarias del Songun.
					
					El Presidente Kim Il Sung fundo el 18 de noviembre del 34 (1945) de la Era Juche la UMDC, le ilumino el camino a seguir y la condujo a desempenar su papel en cada decada de la revolucion en desarrollo.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il preparo la guia programatica a ser mantenida por la UMDC en el cumplimiento de la causa de la revolucion del Songun y le dio gran confianza.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 17 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto central por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la UMDC.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin y otros cuadros interesados y las funcionarias y miembros de la union de mujeres.
					
					Kim Ki Nam dio lectura al mensaje de felicitacion enviado por el CC del PTC a las organizaciones a todos niveles, las funcionarias y miembros de la UMDC con motivo del aniversario 70 de la fundacion.
					
					El mensaje senala que durante los 70 anos despues de su fundacion la UMDC  se ha convertido en la organizacion femenina revolucionaria infinitamente fiel al Partido y al lider bajo la sabida direccion, gran confianza y el amor cordial de los grandes hombres sin pares del monte Paektu y ha cumplido magnificamente su mision y deber asumidos ante la epoca y la historia dejando las huellas claras en la historia de la lucha del pueblo coreano.
					
					Evalua mucho que las organizaciones a todos niveles, funcionarias y miembros de la UMDC vinieron esforzandose abnegadamente por intensificar y desarrollar la dicha union como filas de las revolucionarias y cumplir su noble responsabilidad y papel asumidos ante la epoca y la revolucion en la lucha por lograr la victoria final.
					
					Ademas hubo el informe de la presidenta del CC de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun.

articles.title: Autoridades surcoreanas deben despertarse de ilusion absurda, apunta Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Autoridades surcoreanas deben despertarse de ilusion absurda, apunta Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El dia 5, la gobernadora surcoreana subrayo la necesidad del "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" en Chongwadae y que "lo mas importante en visperas de la unificacion" es la "dignidad fuerte" y la "clara concepcion del valor sobre la historia".
					Esto deviene una abierta declaracion de que a traves del "sistema" arriba mencionado, propagara embelleciendo como el supuesto "valor" y "ortodoxia" su corrupto "sistema democratico y liberal" y la historia vergonzosa del sistema de dominio colonial de Estados Unidos y, basandose en esto, realizara la "unificacion mediante la fusion de regimenes".
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este martes y prosigue:
					
					Los alborotos por aplicar el "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" es la imperdonable locura conflictiva encaminada a realizar la "unificacion mediante la fusion de regimenes" calumniando atrozmente la digna idea y regimen de la Republica e inculcando la hostilidad a esta.
					
					Ahora, al hablar del contenido del manual de historia la banda conservadora surcoreana difama arbitrariamente la dignidad y el regimen de la RPDC tergiversando y calumniando la historia de la orgullosa lucha armada antijaponesa, en que logro con brillantez la causa de la liberacion de la patria y abrio nueva era de la independencia y la prosperidad enarbolando la gran idea Juche, y la historia digna en que ha manifestado patentemente la dignidad y el aspecto majestuoso de la nacion.
					
					No hay duda de que estas maniobras es un ardid tendente a sembrar con la demagogia la cognicion negativa y el sentimiento recusante a la digna historia de la RPDC y el regimen socialista centrado en las masas populares en la sociedad surcoreana para asi realizar la ambicion de la "unificacion bajo el sistema democratico y liberal".
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben conocer correctamente la corriente de la tendencia y despertarse de la ilusion absurda de la "unificacion mediante la fusion de regimenes".

articles.title: Minju Jonson critica diplomacia mendigante de canciller surcoreano
articles.content:
Minju Jonson critica diplomacia mendigante de canciller surcoreano
Pyongyang, 17 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El canciller surcoreano Yun Pyong Se se entrega a mendigar la "cooperacion en el problema nuclear del Norte".
					En la reciente conversacion con el canciller irani disparateo que "tambien el Norte saque las lecciones" en el acuerdo nuclear de Iran y aconsejo vilmente que este pais persico diera una influencia positiva a la solucion del problema nuclear del Norte.
					
					La mendicacion de Yun revela la invariable ambicion de aislar la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en la arena internacional y aplastarla con las armas nucleares junto con las fuerzas foraneas. 
					
					Asi, senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del dia 17 y continua:
					
					Tales actos conflictivos de Yun causan gran indignacion de todos los coreanos que desean la reconciliacion y la unidad nacionales, la paz y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					Si las autoridades surcoreanas tienen de veras la voluntad de solucionar el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana no deben mendigar la "cooperacion en el problema nuclear" anti- RPDC, sino revelar a todo el mundo los crimenes de ellos mismos que introdujeron las armas nucleares de EE.UU. y se pusieron a la cabeza de las maniobras de guerra de agresion a la RPDC y liberarse de la idea proyanqui y el servilismo a EE.UU.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben tener presente que sus actos conflictivos ponen solo los obstaculos en la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas y la "cooperacion en el problema nuclear del Norte" con las fuerzas foraneas traera solo su autodestruccion.
					
					La RPDC no perdonara jamas y aplastara estrictamente a todos los que tratan de atentar su dignidad y sistema.
